EVENT NAME: GSS18 Lectures // Edouard Cabay > Machinic Protocols
EVENT DESCRIPTION:
The lecture Machinic Protocols will be part of the activities of the auto-m√°tic exhibition, curated by Edouard Cabay and on display at the Arts Santa M√≤nica from June 29th to September 2nd 2018.

The work of Machinic Protocols addresses the limits and potentials of generative drawing, emerging from data through mathematical and mechanical operations; raising questions on automation, reproducibility, and the role of the arbitrary or accidents as sources of creative experimentation.

The lecture will be held by Edouard Cabay at the Arts Santa M√≤nica centre, in collaboration with IAAC Global Summer School 2018, an intensive two-week course that connects each participant to ongoing research agendas in robotics, physical computing, digital fabrication with the aim to create new applications of technologies in design.

Duration: 1 hour approximately.
In English without simultaneous translation.
http://artssantamonica.gencat.cat/ca/detall/Machinic-Protocols

Before the lecture, at 18h, the curator of the exhibition Edouard Cabay will give a guided tour of the exhibition auto-m√°tic.

EVENT NAME: An Art Exhibition by Natalia Politowa
EVENT DESCRIPTION: Natalia Politowa is a plastic artist of Russian and German origins, established in Barcelona. Graduated from the prestigious University of Hannover, her artistic activity is divided between fashion design and painting. Since moving to Barcelona she has been collaborating with the young artist collective Art Lover Ground, with which she has exhibited several times, even showing her work work at the influential ARCO art fair in Madrid. Her minimalist, but at the same time expressive and dynamic style, a precise technique and the innovative way of presenting her paintings, have generated great expectation in Barcelona‚Äôs young artists scene. In rLa [3] del Apolo, Natalia Politowa proposes a mutidisciplinary event, where in addition to the exhibition of her works, she will have a special session by the respected Kosmos and Ginebra, to generate an eclectic and suggestive sensory experience.

19 h. Artist Talk: Mireia c. Saladrigues in conversation with Sofia Hult√©n

[ENG] As part of ‚Äúgallery in residence‚Äù (a section of our program developed since 2016 on a yearly basis) √†ngels barcelona is pleased to present an exhibition by artist Sofia Hult√©n (b. 1972, Stockholm), with the collaboration of Galerie NORDENHAKE (Berlin ‚Äì Stockholm).

In line with Hult√©n‚Äôs body of work, which questions the temporality of ordinary household √≠tems and the multiple possibilities offered by them when leaving behind their original functionality, this exhibition aims to highlight the relevance of causality in our daily lives with a series of works that present plural realities and sequential shuffling as an alternative to the given order of things.

[CAS] Como parte de "galer√≠a en residencia" (una secci√≥n de nuestro programa desarrollada anualmente desde 2016) √†ngels barcelona se complace en presentar una exposici√≥n de Sofia Hult√©n (n.1972, Estocolmo), con la colaboraci√≥n de la galer√≠a NORDENHAKE (Berl√≠n - Stcokholm).

En l√≠nea con el trabajo de Hult√©n, que cuestiona la temporalidad de los objetos cotidianos y las m√∫ltiples posibilidades que estos ofrecen al dejar atr√°s su funcionalidad original, esta exposici√≥n busca resaltar la relevancia de la causalidad en nuestra vida cotidiana con una serie de obras que presentan una pluralidad de realidades as√≠ como una multiplicidad de secuencias como posibles alternativas al orden establecido de las cosas.

[CAT] Com a part de "galeria en resid√®ncia" (una secci√≥ del nostre programa desenvolupada anualment des 2016), √†ngels barcelona es complau a presentar una exposici√≥ de Sofia Hult√©n (1972, Estocolm), amb la col¬∑laboraci√≥ de la galeria NORDENHAKE (Berlin - Stockholm).

En l√≠nia amb el treball de Hult√©n, que q√ºestiona la temporalitat dels objectes quotidians i les m√∫ltiples possibilitats que aquests ofereixen en deixar enrere la seva funcionalitat original, aquesta exposici√≥ busca ressaltar la rellev√†ncia de la causalitat en la nostra vida quotidiana amb un seguit d'obres que presenten una pluralitat de realitats aix√≠ com una multiplicitat de seq√º√®ncies com a possibles alternatives a l'ordre establert de les coses.

Taller de p√®ndols de 3 a 6 anys.

Una clau, un cord√≥, una pedra, un cargol, un cordill, poden convertir-se en els nostres p√®ndols, i amb ells buscarem (i crearem) respostes, camins, hist√≤ries, llocs...
No oblidis portar la teva pedra o material preferit!

El taller √©s una proposta de "la musea" com a part del cicle "Una exposici√≥ com un conjur" comissariada per Caterina Almirall. Treballarem la radioest√®sia com una via m√©s del coneixement. El radiestesista produeix microvibracions en el seu cos que es transmeten a l'eina coneguda hist√≤ricament com a p√®ndol. Aquest amplifica la "senyal" en forma de codi de moviment que genera l'operador o radiestesista. Fabricarem tamb√© taules on orientar els senyals. Aquestes poden ser molt variades i molt √∫tils.

Organitzat per Caterina Almirall i Priscila Clementti
